intro: Thelocactus tulensis subsp. buekii, commonly known as the Buekii thorned cactus, is a rare and unique cactus species native to a limited region in southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense clusters of short, spiny stems that form a compact, globular shape. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the rainy season, which are typically short-lived but attract various pollinators. Its leaves are modified into spines, and it has a shallow root system adapted to arid environments. Due to its restricted habitat and conservation status, it is considered a vulnerable species.
